main_name: Nemesia Sunsatia Plus Little Cherry (Sunsatia Plus Series)

botanical_details.genus: Nemesia can be annuals, perennials or sub-shrubs of bushy habit, with simple, opposite leaves and 2-lipped flowers in short racemes or solitary in the leaf axils

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in moist but well-drained, fertile, ideally slightly acid, soil in full sun. Water well in dry spells to maintain flowering
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed, or take softwood cuttings from the ends of non-flowering shoots in late summer and overwinter in frost-free conditions or take softwood cuttings in spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Pinch out growing tips to produce bushy plants, and trim off flowering shoots when initial flowering is finished to promote more flowers
how_to_grow.pests: Generally pest-free but may be susceptible to aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally disease-free, but may be susceptible to foot and root rots in wet soils
